question.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> dissociates from carbaminohaemoglobin in the alveoli when

options.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is high and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is low

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  is high and  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  is low

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  and  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  are equal

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is high and <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">p</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> is low with lesser H<sup>+</sup> concentration

solution.text: When the exchange of oxygen takes place between the blood and the alveolar air, the partial pressure of the oxygen increases, and that time the carbaminohemoglobin dissociates to form carbon-dioxide and  <math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">b</mi><mo>–</mo><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math> . This reduction of the carbon-dioxide content of the haemoglobin due to an increase in the partial pressure of oxygen is also known as the Haldane effect.
